text: Just shipped a feature that reduced our API latency by 40%. Key insight: batch your database calls, even if it feels awkward at first.
author: eng_sarah

text: Unpopular opinion: most startups fail not because of tech debt, but because they build features nobody asked for. Talk to users weekly or die.
author: founder_mike

text: We're seeing a clear pattern in our user research: people don't want more features, they want fewer features that actually work well. Simplicity wins.
author: ux_researcher

text: Thread on what I learned scaling from 0 to 1M users: 1/ Your database will be fine longer than you think. Don't prematurely optimize.
author: cto_jane

text: After interviewing 50 PMs this year, the #1 skill that separates great from good: ruthless prioritization. Everyone says yes to too much.
author: hiring_lead

text: Hot take: the best product decisions come from engineers who talk to customers directly. Remove the game of telephone.
author: product_thinker

text: Noticed something interesting: our power users all discovered the same 'hidden' feature organically. Time to make it prominent.
author: growth_analyst
